title: Set up integration test harness with temp Unity project
description:
Create TestProject/ in repo for end-to-end integration testing.

GOAL: Enable agents to validate Unity package changes end-to-end by testing against a real Unity project.

APPROACH:
1. Create TestProject/ directory in repo root
2. Initialize minimal Unity 2021.3+ project
3. Add package reference to local package (parent directory)
4. Create basic test scenes and scripts
5. Document usage in TestProject/README.md

STRUCTURE:
TestProject/
├── Assets/
│   └── Packages/          # Local package reference
├── ProjectSettings/       # Commit these
├── .claude/              # Created by Unity at runtime
│   └── unity/            # Bridge protocol directory
└── README.md             # Usage instructions

KEY REQUIREMENTS:
- Git-ignore everything except ProjectSettings and README
- Use local package reference (not UPM registry)
- Keep it minimal - just enough to test the bridge
- Document how agents should use it
- Must work with Python skill script: cd skill && python3 scripts/unity_command.py get-status

VALIDATION:
- Unity Editor can open project
- Package is recognized and loaded
- Bridge protocol works (command.json → response.json)
- Python skill script can communicate with Unity

REFERENCE:
- See skill/SKILL.md for bridge protocol
- See AGENTS.md for testing guidelines
close_reason: TestProject created with minimal Unity 2021.3+ setup, local package reference, comprehensive README, and proper gitignore. Manual validation with Unity Editor required to verify end-to-end functionality.
